hypothesis_content.title: Liquid vs Illiquid Altcoin Pairs During Platform Changes
hypothesis_content.statement: Following exchange delisting announcements (like Binance margin removals), the 3-day price divergence between affected illiquid pairs and their most liquid sector counterpart (measured by 30-day average volume) will mean-revert within 10 trading days when traded as a pairs strategy with entry at ±2.5 z-score divergence.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Delisting announcements create panic selling in affected tokens while sector peers experience sympathy moves. The initial overreaction creates divergence between fundamentally similar assets. Liquid peers recover faster due to better market depth, while illiquid tokens overshoot. This provides a mean-reversion opportunity as the structural relationship reasserts.
entry_conditions: Exchange announces delisting/removal of margin trading pairs
Identify affected token (A) and most liquid sector peer (B) with similar use case
Calculate 10-day z-score of A/B price ratio using pre-announcement 60-day history
Enter when z-score > +2.5 (short A/long B) or < -2.5 (long A/short B)
Volume condition: Peer B's 30-day avg volume > 5x token A's volume
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of trades hit stop loss before take profit OR median holding period >8 days for profitable trades.
